therian

Class TherianContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.el.ELContext
      • uelbox.ELContextWrapper
        • therian.TherianContext

  • public class TherianContext
extends uelbox.ELContextWrapper
    Therian context.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TherianContext.Caching
      Caching TherianContext.Hint.
      static interface  TherianContext.Callback<T>
      Callback interface.
      static interface  TherianContext.Hint
      Generalizes a hint targeted to some Operator that can be set on the context.
      class  TherianContext.NestedELContextWrapper
      Nested ELContextWrapper that wraps what this TherianContext wraps, which can be used with "utility" ELResolver wrappers.

      • evalIfSupported

        public final <RESULT,OPERATION extends Operation<RESULT>> RESULT evalIfSupported(OPERATION operation,
                                                                  TherianContext.Hint... hints)
        Evaluates operation if supported; otherwise returns null. You may distinguish between a null result and "not supported" by calling #supports(Operation) and #eval(Operation) independently.
        Parameters:
        operation -
        hints -
        Returns:
        RESULT or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - on null input
        OperationException - potentially, via Operation.getResult()

      • eval

        public final <RESULT,OPERATION extends Operation<RESULT>> RESULT eval(OPERATION operation,
                                                       TherianContext.Hint... hints)
        Performs the specified Operation by invoking any compatible Operator until the Operation is marked as having been successful, then returns the result from Operation.getResult(). Note that most unsuccessful Operations will, at this point, throw an OperationException.
        Parameters:
        RESULT -
        OPERATION -
        operation -
        hints - added as context objects which are accessible to any Operators that are aware of them; should be unique by TherianContext.Hint.getType()
        Returns:
        RESULT
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - on null input
        OperationException - potentially, via Operation.getResult()
        See Also:
        #eval(Operation)
